item.description:
Urban Oaks Farm will host The Green Faire on May 21 from 10am-4pm. The festival features an amazing day of activities for both adults and children with an emphasis on fun for the whole community.

Admission is free!

Learn how to compost effectively in the city with passive 3-bin style or verma-composting, get information on self-watering container gardening, creative construction using re-claimed materials and participate in interactive gardening workshops. Children will get an opportunity to pet rabbits and other furry critters!

The festival also features a marketplace and information area with vendors from all over the Connecticut area including:

Keifer’s Kettle Korn
Alchemy Cafe
CT NOFA
Stonewall Apiary
Green Monster E-cycle
Sweet Sage Bakery
Peoples Products
The Farmers Cow
Habitat For Humanity
Lotus Leaf Tea
N.U Energy Conservation
Beltane Farms
... and many more!


Live performances...

Bill Stillinger Jazz Band

Garden of Beats Drum Circle

Bamba E Plano DJ

Condiut Gongs & Tibetan Bowls Concert 

 

For more information, see the flyer below or check out the Facebook event.


E-cycling services for any type of electronics are provided free of charge so bring your old cell phones, iPods, radios, computers, batteries, etc.

Urban Oaks Farm is conveniently located off Routes 72 West and Route 9 North/South or multiple city bus routes. There is also ample free parking.

The Green Faire is also co-sponsored by The ReCONNstruction Center and First Lutheran Church of New Britain.

 

﻿

Bill Stillinger Jazz Band

Garden Of Beats Drum Circle

Bamba-E Plano D.J. 

The Conduit Gongs & Tibetan Bowls Concert
item.why: We can think globally while acting locally!
item.name: The Green Faire at Urban Oaks
